meanings.definition: A musical instrument played by means of a keyboard
meanings.sent1: The school had a room filled with harpsichords for the students to practice on.
meanings.sent2: The musician played a beautiful melody on the harpsichords during the concert.
meanings.sent3: The harpsichords at the music store seemed to be having a conversation with each other.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the harpsichords filled the room like a gentle breeze on a summer day.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the harpsichords made them look like elegant pieces of furniture.

meanings.sent1: In the music museum, there were many harpsichords on display from different time periods.
meanings.sent2: The orchestra needed more harpsichords for their upcoming performance.
meanings.sent3: The collection of harpsichords in the room made it feel like a magical forest of music.
meanings.sent4: The harpsichords in the room stood out like colorful flowers in a field of green grass.
meanings.sent5: The harmonious sounds of the harpsichords echoed through the concert hall.

meanings.definition: Used to refer to multiple harpsichords
meanings.sent1: The music shop had a sale on harpsichords, so I bought two for my home.
meanings.sent2: At the music festival, there were rows of harpsichords lined up for the performers.
meanings.sent3: The room was so full of harpsichords that it felt like a crowded party of instruments.
meanings.sent4: The sound of multiple harpsichords playing together was like a symphony of keys and strings.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the many harpsichords on stage was a breathtaking display of musical artistry.
